dtliExcerpt: Jordan E. Cooper’s “Ain’t No Mo’,” a blast of a Black Broadway show, doesn’t so much occupy the space between sketch comedy and old-school play as smash a hole in whatever barrier has been assumed to divide them.
showScoreExcerpt:
"Angry, funny, uncompromising and performed at an extraordinarily high level...It abandons caution to the winds and really, really goes there, meaning wherever the heck Cooper wants."
